reviews.text:
üê¶ü¶ÖüïäÔ∏èüê¶‚Äçüî•üê¶‚Äç‚¨õü¶úThe Bird Singing Area at Bedok Reservoir Park is a delicated area where bird hobbyist gather to showcase their songbirds.
ü¶úJudging from the sheer number of cage hanging poles, it must have been a lively chorus of birdsongs echoing the entire area when the hobbyist are all gathered here.
ü¶ÖBird keeping has been a traditional hobby since the 19 century, or earlier, going by historical records.
üê¶‚Äç‚¨õBut this traditional hobby is losing popularity in this fast-pace city life and where people are living in close proximity like in HDB flats that individual space and noise level are fiercely guarded.
ü¶ÖNoisy bird calls while still in bed is the last thing you want.
ü¶úParadoxically, It would be a great loss, should this traditional pastime be gone.
üêßSo far, the other park where a space is delicated to Bird Singing is at Ang Mo Kio Town Garden West.
üê¶‚Äçüî•Fun fact:
In 2018, songbird rearing was designated as Intangible Cultural Heritage by Singapore's Natiinal Heritage Board. üê¶

The birdsinging area is a tranquil and peaceful spot to chill. You can see uncles relaxing there and having their conversations. When you walk by, you can identify this spot by the distinct chirping noises of the birds and the characteristic candy cane like structures. This spot is also near Burp Kitchen, so you can come hear after a meal there.
Only on sundays. Mostly Hwamei bird.
An oasis for bird geeks. I like it. When I come to places like this, I feel like Singapore is great.
